medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The headache began abruptly 6 days prior to presentation, described as nonpulsating discomfort in the right retro-orbital area, not relieved by ibuprofen. A day before presentation, he noted subjective fevers. Two days after initial presentation, he developed new neck stiffness and myalgias.
medical_history.social_history: The patient was a graduate student, drank alcohol socially, smoked two cigarettes a month, and occasionally smoked marijuana. He had no recent sexual activity but used condoms in the past. Recent travel included a four-day vacation at a cattle ranch in Texas.
